wait_poses.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 import rospy
4 
5 from std_msgs.msg import Bool, Int16
6 
7 # a class to capture key poses of the panda
8 
9 
10 class WaitPose():
11 
12  def __init__(self, joints=7):
13 
14  """
15  Creates a wait pose object.
16 
17  Arguments
18  ----------
19  `joints`: `int`
20  Sets the amount of joints in the desired robot
21 
22  Returns
23  ----------
24  returns: None
25  """
26 
27  # publisher for when the user wants the pose to be captured
28  rospy.init_node("wait_poses", anonymous=True)
29 
30  self.pose_num_pub = rospy.Publisher("zero_g_pose_num", Int16)
31  self.is_in_captured_pose_pub = rospy.Publisher("is_in_captured_pose", Bool)
32  self.poses = rospy.get_param("/zero_g_poses", default=11)
33 
34  self.pose_num = 0
35 
36  def wait_poses(self):
37  """
38  Waits for all of the poses. Requires a user to press enter
39  when the desired pose is reached. Peforms this for
40  `self.poses` times.
41 
42  Arguments
43  ----------
44  None
45 
46  Returns
47  ----------
48  returns: None
49  """
50  for i in range(self.poses):
51  self.pose_num = i
52 
53  self.pose_num_pub.publish(Int16(self.pose_num))
54  self.is_in_captured_pose_pub.publish(Bool(False))
55  print("Please move the robot to the desired pose.")
56  raw_input("Press enter to capture the pose: ") # noqa: F821
57  self.is_in_captured_pose_pub.publish(Bool(True))
58  print("==========================")
59  print("Please wait 1 second in this pose...")
60  # sleep for 5 seconds
61  rospy.sleep(1)
62 
63 
64 if __name__ == "__main__":
65  wp = WaitPose()
66  wp.wait_poses()
